column1: Cleft lip and cleft palate repair is surgery to fix birth defects of the upper lip and palate (roof of the mouth).
A cleft lip is a birth defect: - A cleft lip may be just a small notch in the lip.
Most times, cleft palate repair is done when the child is older, between 9 months and 1 year old.

Include drugs, herbs, and vitamins you bought without a prescription During the days before the surgery: - About 10 days before the surgery, you will be asked to stop giving your child aspirin, ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin), warfarin (Coumadin), and any other drugs that make it hard for your child's blood to clot.
- Give your child a small sip of water with any drugs your doctor told you to give your child.
- The provider will make sure your child is healthy before the surgery.
It is important for your child not to put hands or toys in the mouth.
A child who had a cleft palate repair may need to see a dentist or orthodontist.
Hearing problems are common in children with cleft lip or cleft palate.
Your child may still have problems with speech after the surgery.
